actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the Journal of the proceedings of the Senate was deemed approved to date.
Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the morning hour being deemed expired, and the times for the recognition of the two leaders being reserved.
The following transactions of morning business occurred on today.

S.Res. 768 (Sen. Braun):
        A resolution congratulating the Fighting Irish of the University of Notre Dame men's lacrosse team for winning the 2024 National Collegiate Athletic Association Division I Men's Lacrosse National Championship.

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.


 S.Res. 769 (Sen. Padilla):
        A resolution recognizing the importance of mental health for youth in the United States, and expressing the pressing need for awareness and support for mental health care for children and adolescents.

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.


 S.Res. 770 (Sen. Klobuchar):
        A resolution expressing support for the designation of July 2024 as "Disability Pride Month".

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.

PN1344:
        Margaret L. Taylor, of Maryland, to be Legal Adviser of the Department of State

        -- Cloture invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 51 - 43. Record Vote Number: 217 


        -- Considered by Senate.


 PN1400:
        Kashi Way, of Maryland, to be a Judge of the United States Tax Court for a term of fifteen years

        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Cloture invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 78 - 16. Record Vote Number: 215 


        -- By unanimous consent agreement, vote 7/25/2024.


 PN1401:
        Adam B. Landy, of South Carolina, to be a Judge of the United States Tax Court for a term of fifteen years

        -- Cloture invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 85 - 12. Record Vote Number: 216 


        -- Considered by Senate.
By unanimous consent, on the request of Mr. Schatz, at  7:42 p.m., the Senate adjourned, under its order of today, until 10 a.m. tomorrow.
